pp2016.team19.shared

Class Monster

  • java.lang.Object
    • pp2016.team19.shared.Character
      • pp2016.team19.shared.Monster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Monster
extends Character

    Monster Class extending Character class and providing last action times, cooldown times, whether it takes the key, the last action it performed, the player position, the path where to flee, whether it just attacked, the type it is of, the player and the game it belongs to.

    Class Monster describes every logic of the monsters, how they fight, how they search a way to the player, how they flee, and so on.
    Author:
    Strohbuecker, Max, 5960738
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Monster

        public Monster(int x,
               int y,
               Game game,
               int type)
        Contructor of the class Monster.
        Parameters:
        x - Coordinate, where the monster should spawn
        y - Coordinate, where the monster should spawn
        game - game which the monster belongs to, contains the gamefield/map and the player data
        type - Type of the monster (0 = spawns at the beginning, 1 = spawns after taking the key)

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        The FSM of the monster. It decides (depending on the situation) what the monster should do next (move to the player, flee or regenerate health).

      • moveToPlayer

        public void moveToPlayer()
        Moves the monster to the player. If the playerPos has changed, it calls the AStar to calculate a new path to him and the monster goes the first step of the path. Otherwise the monster should go further the calculated path.

      • flee

        public boolean flee()
        Compares the position of the player to the position of the monster and moves the monster away of the player into the corner.
        Returns:
        returns whether there's a position to flee to

      • getFleePos

        public Node getFleePos()
        Calculates the point, where the monster should flee to.
        Returns:
        returns a Node with the fleeing position

      • attackPlayer

        public boolean attackPlayer(boolean hasKey)
        Attacks the player and gives damage
        Parameters:
        hasKey - does the player have the key?
        Returns:
        returns, whether a player is in attacking range of the monster.

      • playerInRange

        public boolean playerInRange(int monsterX,
                             int monsterY)
        Calculates, whether the player is in range of the monster (Needed for move() and getFleePos()).
        Parameters:
        monsterX - x-coordinate of the monster position
        monsterY - y-coordinate of the monster position
        Returns:
        returns whether the player is in range of the monster
